ARABIC: إِنَّكُمْ لَتَأْتُونَ ٱلرِّجَالَ شَهْوَةً مِّن دُونِ ٱلنِّسَآءِ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ مُّسْرِفُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: You come with lust to men instead of women. You are indeed a depraved people.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: In preference to women you satisfy your lust with men. Indeed you are a people who are guilty of excess."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: You approach men lustfully in place of women. You are a people who exceed all bounds.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: You engage in lustful activities with people instead of women. You have become transgressing people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “You lustfully go towards men, instead of women! In fact, you have transgressed the limits.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, you practice your lusts on men instead of women. Nay, but you are a people transgressing beyond bounds."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Most surely you come to males in lust besides females; nay you are an extravagant people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: See, you approach men lustfully instead of women; no, you are a people that do exceed.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! ye come with lust unto men instead of women. Nay, but ye are wanton folk.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: You lust after men rather than women! You transgress all bounds!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily ye go in lustfully unto men instead of women! Aye! ye are a people extravagant.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed you come to men with desire instead of women! Indeed, you are a profligate lot.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: For ye practise your lusts on men in preference to women: ye are indeed a people transgressing beyond bounds."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, you practise your lusts on men instead of women. Nay, but you are a people transgressing beyond bounds (by committing great sins)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: You approach men lustfully instead of women. Truly, you are a nation who exceed (in sin)'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: “You lust after men rather than women. You are an excessive people.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, you approach men with desire, instead of women. Rather, you are a transgressing people."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [7:81] Do you (read a-innakum, pronouncing both hamzas, or by not pronouncing the second one, but in both cases inserting an alif between the two; a variant reading has innakum, ‘indeed you … ’) come lustfully to men instead of women? Nay, you are a wanton folk’, transgressing [the bounds], [going] from what is lawful to what is unlawful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! ye come with lust) you find more lust (unto men) in men's behinds (instead of women) instead of the vaginas of women. (Nay, but ye, are wanton folk) in idolatry; you transgress from the lawful to that which is prohibited.
